HL1 is a good game, but the source port of it is very, VERY janky. took a lot of fine tuning to get working, and there are some levels that induce a lot of screen tearing, graphical glitches, and other things.

Try to find a different port if possible!

its nice

This was the sequel we all NEEDED. The game is a perfect 10/10, fixing many of the problems that i had with the original game, e.g. forcing you to have HD pack on, weird water, lighting bugs and more. This game is something of a masterpiece, and i'm looking forward to playing half life 2 on the original Xbox, as my current pc isn't powerful enough to run it.

I guess Valve was so excited about their new engine, that they couldn't wait for the release of HL2, so they decided to just release the first game again, but with the new engine. the source engine was great and definetly innovative for it's time and HL Source does look prettier, the advanced lighting add nicely to the atmosphere and look of the areas and the effects have a bit more detail, making them stand out a little more. But other than that, this "remaster" adds absolutely nothing. it's still HL1 just a little prettier and with fucked scripting (look at chapter 5 and you see what I mean) I don't understand why this was sold as a product, when it's just HL1 again, the visuals don't even justify the price, cause it isn't that big of an upgrade, it still looks like HL1, with more lighting and physics. HL Source is a tech demo. maybe it was exciting for people, who wanted to get a taste of Valve's new engine, but even then, there really is no reason to sink in more, than like 20 min, when you already played the original HL.

My mistake for buying the source version. Initially, I thought it was fine until I ran into a couple of game breaking glitches, like sometimes when you crouch, bullets go through you. On one of the levels, it's almost impossible to complete the mission because of the broken helicopter hit box... Another level, the textures have a seizure and spasm across the screen. Half-Life is amazing and I eventually got the original, but this port is absolute trash.

The favorite game of my childhood. The scope of it was huge, never done before. As a young teen finding myself in black mesa causing a resonance cascade and everything after was.... exhilarating. It was mesmerizing to me, it was like a movie. I remember having a 133MHz pentium with a 800MB hard drive... I had to delete everything i had on except for windows to be able to fit it. It was unheard of back then. So worth it. Great, great times.
I mean, its half life but just buy the regular version.

half life but juicy

I have completed this game a few times but it is still by far one of the best FPS's that I have ever played.

I have encountered a couple bugs here and there (floating scientist & some others I cannot remember) but overall it didn't contain any game-breaking issues.

Since it's a Valve game, it really does feel like people put love and effort into this game. It just feels very thrilling and sort of homely if that makes sense.

I tried the original Half-Life (GOTY CD) but the game had a really old interface that was just confusing to me. It took me a few days to get the monitor size correct! So, this feels a lot better and easier to understand. While I'm on this topic, I'm gonna mention how this port has a lot more advanced and sophisticated settings. 

My summary of this game so far is that it is a phenomenal port of a late 90's classic. It's easy to understand while still implementing new and helpful features. I would highly recommend it if you prefer modern GUI and controls.

EDIT: I've just discovered that if you try hard enough, you can get Half-Life 2 to run with just Half-Life: Source files. You can also run HL2 mods through HL:S with no further installation. Just install the mods like you'd do with any other HL2 mod. It's basically a 2 in 1 package. Only downside is bugs and no Goldsrc mods. But, I'd say the pros outweight the cons here.
High-quality

There's a mod that fixes all the issues with this game, it fixes the overly shiny guns, buggy skyboxes, armor that deflects bullets, and most importantly in my opinion, the moment when (spoilers) that marine shoots the scientist in "We've got hostiles". In the original HL Source, the marine just runs past the scientist and ruins a great and shocking moment, but thankfully the mod restores it. Here's a link.

https://www.moddb.com/mods/half-life-source-fixed

Not a great port. It's far from the worst one I've ever played but the game does not work well in the source engine. Countless bugs, broken AI, and invisible barnacle tongues. Play the original version or Black Mesa if it runs on your pc.

I'm uncertain about what my true feelings of this game are. There is a bit of good, there is a bit of bad. You can get used to the many problems within it, and so far I haven't seen any major issues apart from something in the beginning. There is many things that could be improved upon (crowbar sounds, reflective textures, sometimes the water textures). Overall, it is a decent game, but it could be improved upon.

Half-Life Source die Grafisch neu bearbeitete Version von Half-Life aus 1998. Spielerisch wie  beim alten allerdings mit Sound Fehler oder Bugs, die das Spiel ein wenig beeintr√§chtigen. Zum  Beispiel: Nachlade-Sounds fehlen oder Level-design in Background flackert helles Licht usw.

Trotzdem macht es Spa√ü,  wenn  man alle 2 Min. Schnellspeicher um Frust oder Verbugte NPC's denn  gesamten Game zu versauen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2726211339 

Pro:
+Story
+Bunnny-Jump
+Musik
+Level Struktur
+Waffen Verschiedenheit
+Wasser Grafik

Con:
-Nach dem Black Mesa Ausbruch erscheinen die ersten Level-Bugs, da alles rum flackert, erkennt man 80% nix
-Kein Nachladen Sound
-Granatenwurf-Animation b√§h
